contents.text: 4. Implementation Analysis
contents.zh-CHS: 4. 实施分析

contents.text: A management application that supports RFC 3276 could mistakenly flag a unit that responds with a rate or wire pair that exceeds the ranges and/or enumerations specified in RFC 3276. For example, a G.shdsl.bis line with four wire pairs would report statistics for wire pairs that do not exist in RFC 3276. That is, a GET-NEXT request issues with the object identifier:
contents.zh-CHS: 支持RFC 3276的管理应用程序可能会错误地标记响应速率或线对超过RFC 3276中指定的范围和/或枚举的单元。例如，具有四个线对的G.shdsl.bis线将报告RFC 3276中不存在的线对的统计信息。也就是说，GET-NEXT请求与对象标识符有关：

contents.text: hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrAtn.1.1.1.2
contents.zh-CHS: hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrAtn.1.1.2

contents.text: might return
contents.zh-CHS: 可能会回来

contents.text: hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrAtn.1.1.1.3 = 0
contents.zh-CHS: hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrAtn.1.1.3=0

contents.text: with a G.shdsl.bis unit and
contents.zh-CHS: 带有G.shdsl.bis装置和

contents.text: hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrSnrMgn.1.1.1.1 = 0
contents.zh-CHS: hdsl2ShdslEndpointCurrSnrMgn.1.1.1=0

contents.text: with an HDSL2 unit as these objects are indexed by
contents.zh-CHS: 使用HDSL2单元作为这些对象的索引

contents.text: INDEX { ifIndex, hdsl2ShdslInvIndex, hdsl2ShdslendpointSide, hdsl2ShdslEndpointWirePair }
contents.zh-CHS: 索引{iIndex，hdsl2ShdslInvIndex，hdsl2ShdslendpointSide，hdsl2ShdslEndpointWirePair}

contents.text: A management application intended to manage G.shdsl.bis agents SHOULD be modified to accept this sequence.
contents.zh-CHS: 应修改旨在管理G.shdsl.bis代理的管理应用程序，以接受此序列。

contents.text: One should note that this same unmodified management application is still capable of managing G.shdsl.bis agents albeit to the degree of G.SHDSL (non-bis) limitations. That is, it can create and monitor configurations limited to two wire pairs with an upper-rate limit of 4112000 bits/second.
contents.zh-CHS: 应该注意的是，这个未经修改的管理应用程序仍然能够管理G.shdsl.bis代理，尽管受到G.shdsl（非bis）的限制。也就是说，它可以创建和监视限制为两个线对的配置，速率上限为4112000位/秒。

contents.text: 5. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 安全考虑

contents.text: There are a number of management objects defined in this MIB module with a MAX-ACCESS clause of read-write and/or read-create. Such objects may be considered sensitive or vulnerable in some network environments. The support for SET operations in a non-secure environment without proper protection can have a negative effect on network operations. These are the tables and objects and their sensitivity/vulnerability:
contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB模块中定义了许多管理对象，其MAX-ACCESS子句为read-write和/或read-create。在某些网络环境中，此类对象可能被视为敏感或易受攻击。在没有适当保护的非安全环境中支持SET操作可能会对网络操作产生负面影响。以下是表和对象及其敏感度/漏洞：

contents.text: o hdsl2ShdslSpanConfTable
contents.zh-CHS: o HDSL2SHDSLSPANConfitable

contents.text: The table consists of the following objects that support SET operations:
contents.zh-CHS: 该表由以下支持集合操作的对象组成：

contents.text: * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfNumRepeaters * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfile * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfAlarmProfile
contents.zh-CHS: * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfNumRepeaters*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfile*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfAlarmProfile

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfNumRepeaters could result in an hdsl2ShdslSpanInvalidNumRepeaters notification. Note the discussion on hdsl2ShdslSpanInvalidNumRepeaters in the Notifications section above.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权对hdsl2ShdslSpanConfNumRepeaters进行更改可能会导致hdsl2ShdslSpanInvalidNumRepeaters通知。注意上面通知部分中关于HDSL2SHDSLSpanInvalidNumRepeater的讨论。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfile could have an adverse operational effect on a span. Reference the hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileTable discussion below.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权对hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfile进行更改可能会对span产生不利的操作影响。请参考下面的hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileTable讨论。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfAlarmProfile could have a contrary effect on notifications. Reference the hdsl2ShdslEndpointAlarmConfProfileTable discussion below.
contents.zh-CHS: 对hdsl2ShdslSpanConfAlarmProfile进行未经授权的更改可能会对通知产生相反的影响。请参考下面的HDSL2SHDSLendPointAlarmConfProfile表讨论。

contents.text: o hdsl2ShdslEndpointConfTable
contents.zh-CHS: o hdsl2ShdslEndpointConfTable

contents.text: This table contains one object, hdsl2ShdslEndpointAlarmConfProfile, that supports SET operations. Unauthorized changes could have an undesirable notifications. Reference the hdsl2ShdslEndpointAlarmConfProfileTable discussion below.
contents.zh-CHS: 此表包含一个支持集合操作的对象hdsl2ShdslEndpointAlarmConfProfile。未经授权的更改可能会产生不需要的通知。请参考下面的HDSL2SHDSLendPointAlarmConfProfile表讨论。

contents.text: o hdsl2ShdslEndpointMaintTable
contents.zh-CHS: o hdsl2ShdslEndpointMaintTable

contents.text: The table consists of the following objects that support SET operations:
contents.zh-CHS: 该表由以下支持集合操作的对象组成：

contents.text: * hdsl2ShdslMaintLoopbackConfig * hdsl2ShdslMaintPowerBackoff * hdsl2ShdslMaintSoftRestart
contents.zh-CHS: * hdsl2ShdslMaintLoopbackConfig*hdsl2ShdslMaintPowerBackoff*hdsl2ShdslMaintSoftRestart

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslMaintLoopbackConfig could prevent end-to-end data transfer due to an activation of a loopback.
contents.zh-CHS: 对hdsl2ShdslMaintLoopbackConfig进行未经授权的更改可能会由于激活环回而阻止端到端数据传输。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslMaintPowerBackoff could result in an increased in bundle interference.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权更改hdsl2ShdslMaintPowerBackoff可能会导致捆绑内干扰增加。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslMaintSoftRestart could result in a temporary interruption of end-to-end data transfer as the result of the triggering of a soft restart.
contents.zh-CHS: 对hdsl2ShdslMaintSoftRestart进行未经授权的更改可能会触发软重启，从而导致端到端数据传输暂时中断。

contents.text: o hdsl2ShdslUnitMaintTable
contents.zh-CHS: o HDSL2SHDSLUNITMAINTABLE

contents.text: This table contains one object, hdsl2ShdslMaintLoopbackTimeout, that supports SET operations. An unauthorized change to this object could result in the timeout value for loopbacks being increased, decreased, or disabled.
contents.zh-CHS: 此表包含一个支持设置操作的对象hdsl2ShdslMaintLoopbackTimeout。对此对象进行未经授权的更改可能会导致环回超时值增加、减少或禁用。

contents.text: o hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileTable
contents.zh-CHS: o hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileTable

contents.text: The table consists of the following objects that support SET operations:
contents.zh-CHS: 该表由以下支持集合操作的对象组成：

contents.text: * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWireInterface * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMinLineRate * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMaxLineRate * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfPSD * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfTransmissionMode * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfRemoteEnabled * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfPowerFeeding * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfCurrCondTargetMarginDown * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginDown * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfCurrCondTargetMarginUp * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginUp * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfUsedTargetMargins * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfReferenceClock * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfLineProbeEnable * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileRowStatus
contents.zh-CHS: * hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWireInterface*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMinLineRate*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMaxLineRate*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfPSD*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfTransmissionMode*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfRemoteEnabled*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfPowerFeeding*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfCurrCondTargetMarginDown*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginDown*HDSL2SHDSLSPANConfCurrencConditTargetMarginup*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginUp*HDSL2SHDSLSPANConfLuxedTargetMarginup*HDSL2SHDSLSPANConfReferenceLock*HDSL2SHDSLSPANConfConflineproblem*hdsl2ShdslSpanConfProfileRowStatus

contents.text: Setting any of the objects to an incorrect value could have an adverse operational effect on a span.
contents.zh-CHS: 将任何对象设置为不正确的值都可能对跨度产生不利的操作影响。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to the hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWireInterface could result in the failure of a span to achieve activation to a state that would permit data flow. For example, setting this object to six-wire or eight-wire operation when one of the units in the span only supports two-wire or four-wire operation would likely prevent an expected end-to-end data transfer capability.
contents.zh-CHS: 对HDSL2SHDSLSPANConfwire接口的未经授权的更改可能导致span无法激活到允许数据流的状态。例如，当跨度中的一个单元仅支持双线或四线操作时，将此对象设置为六线或八线操作可能会阻止预期的端到端数据传输能力。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMinLineRate or hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMaxLineRate could have an adverse effect on performance. The range of allowable line rates could be altered such that the span may not be able to train to a line rate that
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权更改hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMinLineRate或hdsl2ShdslSpanConfMaxLineRate可能会对性能产生不利影响。允许线路速率的范围可以改变，以便跨度可能无法训练到

contents.text: would permit any end-user data to traverse the span or the span could train to a line rate that is either greater than or less than the line rate that the provider has pledged.
contents.zh-CHS: 将允许任何最终用户数据穿过跨度，或者跨度可以训练到大于或小于提供商承诺的线速率的线速率。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfPSD or hdsl2ShdslSpanConfTransmissionMode could have a detrimental effect on loop reach, performance, or spectral compatibility.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权更改hdsl2ShdslSpanConfPSD或hdsl2ShdslSpanConfTransmissionMode可能会对环路范围、性能或频谱兼容性产生不利影响。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfRemoteEnable could alter the remote management ability of units.
contents.zh-CHS: 对hdsl2ShdslSpanConfRemoteEnable进行未经授权的更改可能会改变设备的远程管理能力。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfPowerFeeding could shutdown units that are expected to be fed power remotely. Changing the configuration such that wetting current is not supplied may result in corrosion of electrical contacts.
contents.zh-CHS: 对HDSL2SHDSLSPANConfPowerFeed进行未经授权的更改可能会关闭预期远程供电的装置。改变配置以不提供湿润电流可能会导致电触点腐蚀。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfCurrCondTargetMarginDown, hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginDown, hdsl2ShdslSpanConfCurrCondTargetMarginUp, hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginUp, or hdsl2ShdslSpanConfUsedTargetMargins could result in invalid parameters used to determine if a data rate can be supported under current and worst-case noise.
contents.zh-CHS: 对hdsl2ShdslSpanConfCurrCondTargetMarginDown、hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginDown、hdsl2ShdslSpanConfCurrCondTargetMarginUp、hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginUp、hdsl2ShdslSpanConfWorstCaseTargetMarginUp的未经授权更改，或HDSL2SHDSLSPAN ConfusedTargetMargins可能导致用于确定在当前和最坏情况下是否支持数据速率的参数无效。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfReferenceClock could result in the selection of a clock source that might either prevent any data from being transferred or impair data transfer. In addition, an increase in CRC anomalies may be experienced.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权对HDSL2SHDSLSpanConfReferenceLock进行更改可能会导致选择时钟源，该时钟源可能会阻止任何数据传输或影响数据传输。此外，CRC异常可能会增加。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to hdsl2ShdslSpanConfLineProbeEnable could have a negative effect on selecting the optimum rate or power level based on current line conditions.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权更改HDSL2SHDSLSPANCLINEPROBEENABLE可能会对根据当前线路条件选择最佳速率或功率水平产生负面影响。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to row status could result in unwanted profiles being created or brought into service. Also, changes to the row status could result in profiles being inadvertently deleted or taken out of service.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权更改行状态可能会导致创建或使用不需要的配置文件。此外，对行状态的更改可能会导致配置文件被无意中删除或停止使用。

contents.text: o hdsl2ShdslEndpointAlarmConfProfileTable
contents.zh-CHS: o HDSL2SHDSLendPointAlarmConfProfile表

contents.text: The table consists of the following objects that support SET operations:
contents.zh-CHS: 该表由以下支持集合操作的对象组成：

contents.text: * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshLoopAttenuation * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshSNRMargin * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshES * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshSES
contents.zh-CHS: * HDSL2SHDSLendPointThreshLoop衰减*hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshSNRMargin*hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshES*hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshES

contents.text: * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshCRCanomalies * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshLOSWS * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshUAS * hdsl2ShdslEndpointAlarmConfProfileRowStatus
contents.zh-CHS: * hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshCRCanomalies*hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshLOSWS*hdsl2ShdslEndpointThreshUAS*hdsl2ShdslEndpointAlarmConfProfileRowStatus

contents.text: Increasing any of the threshold values could result in a notification being suppressed or deferred. Setting a threshold to 0 could result in a notification being suppressed. Suppressing or deferring a notification could prevent the timely delivery of important diagnostic information. Decreasing any of the threshold values could result in a notification being sent from the network falsely reporting a threshold crossing.
contents.zh-CHS: 增加任何阈值都可能导致通知被抑制或延迟。将阈值设置为0可能会导致通知被抑制。禁止或推迟通知可能会妨碍重要诊断信息的及时传递。降低任何阈值都可能导致从网络发送的通知错误地报告阈值交叉。

contents.text: Changing a threshold value could also have an impact on the amount of notifications the agent sends. This document adds a paragraph, which was not in RFC 3276 [RFC3276], to the Notifications section that provides general guidance to the rate limiting of notifications. Agent implementations not adhering to the rate-limiting desires could result in notifications being generated at an uncontrolled rate. Unauthorized changes to a threshold value could result in an undesired notification rate.
contents.zh-CHS: 更改阈值也可能会影响代理发送的通知量。本文件在通知部分添加了RFC 3276[RFC3276]中没有的段落，该段落为通知的速率限制提供了一般指导。不遵守速率限制要求的代理实现可能导致以不受控制的速率生成通知。未经授权更改阈值可能会导致意外的通知率。

contents.text: Unauthorized changes to row status could result in unwanted profiles being created or brought into service. Also, changes to the row status could result in profiles being inadvertently deleted or taken out of service.
contents.zh-CHS: 未经授权更改行状态可能会导致创建或使用不需要的配置文件。此外，对行状态的更改可能会导致配置文件被无意中删除或停止使用。

contents.text: Some of the readable objects in this MIB module (i.e., objects with a MAX-ACCESS other than not-accessible) may be considered sensitive or vulnerable in some network environments. It is thus important to control even GET and/or NOTIFY access to these objects and possibly to even encrypt the values of these objects when sending them over the network via SNMP. These are the tables and objects and their sensitivity/vulnerability:
contents.zh-CHS: 在某些网络环境中，此MIB模块中的某些可读对象（即具有MAX-ACCESS而非not ACCESS的对象）可能被视为敏感或易受攻击。因此，在通过SNMP通过网络发送这些对象时，控制甚至获取和/或通知对这些对象的访问，甚至可能加密这些对象的值，这一点非常重要。以下是表和对象及其敏感度/漏洞：

contents.text: o hdsl2ShdslInventoryTable
contents.zh-CHS: o hdsl2ShdslInventoryTable

contents.text: Access to these objects would allow an intruder to obtain information about which vendor's equipment is in use on the network. Further, such information is considered sensitive in many environments for competitive reasons.
contents.zh-CHS: 对这些对象的访问将允许入侵者获取有关网络上使用的供应商设备的信息。此外，由于竞争原因，此类信息在许多环境中被视为敏感信息。

contents.text: * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorID * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorModelNumber * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorSerialNumber * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorEOCSoftwareVersion * hdsl2ShdslInvStandardVersion * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorListNumber
contents.zh-CHS: * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorID*hdsl2ShdslInvVendorModelNumber*hdsl2ShdslInvVendorSerialNumber*HDSL2SHDSLINVvendorOcSoftwareVersion*hdsl2ShdslInvStandardVersion*hdsl2ShdslInvVendorListNumber

contents.text: * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorIssueNumber * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorSoftwareVersion * hdsl2ShdslInvEquipmentCode * hdsl2ShdslInvVendorOther * hdsl2ShdslInvTransmissionModeCapability
contents.zh-CHS: * HDSL2SHDSLINV供应商编号*HDSL2SHDSLINV供应商软件转换*HDSL2SHDSLI投资设备代码*HDSL2SHDSLINV供应商其他*HDSL2SHDSLINV传输模式功能

contents.text: SNMP versions prior to SNMPv3 did not include adequate security. Even if the network itself is secure (for example by using IPsec), even then, there is no control as to who on the secure network is allowed to access and GET/SET (read/change/create/delete) the objects in this MIB module.
contents.zh-CHS: SNMPv3之前的SNMP版本未包含足够的安全性。即使网络本身是安全的（例如通过使用IPsec），即使如此，也无法控制安全网络上的谁可以访问和获取/设置（读取/更改/创建/删除）此MIB模块中的对象。

contents.text: It is RECOMMENDED that implementers consider the security features as provided by the SNMPv3 framework (see [RFC3410], Section 8), including full support for the SNMPv3 cryptographic mechanisms (for authentication and privacy).
contents.zh-CHS: 建议实施者考虑SNMPv3框架所提供的安全特性（参见[RCFC310]，第8节），包括对SNMPv3加密机制的完全支持（用于身份验证和隐私）。

contents.text: Further, deployment of SNMP versions prior to SNMPv3 is NOT RECOMMENDED. Instead, it is RECOMMENDED to deploy SNMPv3 and to enable cryptographic security. It is then a customer/operator responsibility to ensure that the SNMP entity giving access to an instance of this MIB module is properly configured to give access to the objects only to those principals (users) that have legitimate rights to indeed GET or SET (change/create/delete) them.
contents.zh-CHS: 此外，不建议部署SNMPv3之前的SNMP版本。相反，建议部署SNMPv3并启用加密安全性。然后，客户/运营商应负责确保授予访问此MIB模块实例权限的SNMP实体已正确配置为仅授予那些拥有确实获取或设置（更改/创建/删除）对象的合法权限的主体（用户）访问对象。

contents.zh-CHS: 6. 致谢

contents.text: The authors are deeply grateful to the authors of the ADSL LINE MIB (RFC 2662 [RFC2662]), Gregory Bathrick and Faye Ly, as much of the text and structure of this document originate in their documents.
contents.zh-CHS: 作者非常感谢ADSL线路MIB（RFC 2662[RFC2662]）、Gregory Bathrick和Faye Ly的作者，因为本文件的大部分文本和结构源自他们的文件。

contents.text: The authors are also grateful to the authors of FR MFR MIB (RFC 3020 [RFC3020]), Prayson Pate, Bob Lynch, and Kenneth Rehbehn, as the majority of the Security Considerations section was lifted from their document.
contents.zh-CHS: 作者还感谢FR MFR MIB（RFC 3020[RFC3020]）、Prayson Pate、Bob Lynch和Kenneth Rehbehn的作者，因为大部分安全注意事项部分已从他们的文档中删除。

contents.text: The authors also acknowledge the importance of the contributions and suggestions regarding interface indexing structures received from David Horton of CITR.
contents.zh-CHS: 作者还承认了从CITR的David Horton处收到的关于接口索引结构的贡献和建议的重要性。

contents.text: The authors are extremely thankful to Bert Wijnen, Randy Presuhn, and C. M. Heard for their extensive review and the many suggestions they provided.
contents.zh-CHS: 作者非常感谢Bert Wijnen、Randy Presohn和C.M.Heard的广泛评论和他们提供的许多建议。

contents.zh-CHS: 7. 工具书类
